title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: It was an in person interview and i was asked for my previous teaching experiences and the courses i have dealt with etc then i was asked about their academic schedule if there was any conflict etc it was overall easy and behavioral
Interview Questions: What courses you taught previously

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lafayette College (Easton, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: 30 mins each meeting different professors and staffs for 1.5 day. Provided the meal one to one with the chair of the department. Meeting different facilities was helpful to get insights on what they do and how they handle things at their school. Very friendly environment with great people. Students are very active and friendly with professors
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to come here
What is your teaching styles and how will you incorporate that in your teaching?
How do you handle students with different backgrounds

title: Director, Art Galleries Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: Poorly managed process. Had first interview over Zoom--one member of the committee (the Chair) did not show up. The second interview, on campus, was generally fine and lasted from 9am to 9pm. A big red flag was that they did not know who I would report to if hired. I was asked to interview with another person, a dean, over Zoom once I returned home because it couldn't be arranged during the 12 hour campus interview. A member of the search committee asked about my references but never called them, which is unusual and not typical for a professional interview. A month after the interview I emailed the chair, reiterated my interest, and asked about the search status. A full week later I received a reply from the chair that they were no longer chair (!!! shouldn't have been appointed chair in the first place then!!!) and that they had passed my email to someone else. I have not heard and it has been well over 2 months. HR should step in and establish professional norms for interviews. Professors really can't handle the process and it reflects poorly on the college.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with students

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lafayette College (Easton, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very painless, I was just asked a handful of basic questions. I had a connection with someone in the office, so I asked her if they were hiring and could take on another student worker. She said yes, and my interview consisted of a quick conversation with her supervisor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this office?

title: Student Fitness Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: It was a group (three-on-three) interview. Regular questions about why you should get the position and about past experience working with people. They gave you a health emergency case study to see how you think through a situation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Rec. Services?

title: Title IX and Equity Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with potential supervisor, then in person interview with hiring committee and others. The interview was over the course of two days, and I was asked to do two presentations--one for students and one for faculty/staff.
Interview Questions: I can't remember any specific questions, but many staff members are alums and/or their children are current students, so there were multiple questions regarding student needs.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: Brief, no more than a fifteen minute screening session. There is a probation period over which you are assessed periodically and asked to review supplemental materials related to the job.
Interview Questions: Standard screening question - previous work experience and studies etc.

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: I went in for an in person interview after applying online. The whole day went smoothly, talked with the current professors, got a quick tour, gave a talk, and had some lunch. The department was nice and it was a good experience overall, so I accepted their offer in the end.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my past teaching experience.

title: Teacher's Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted due to superior academic performance. The process included a short interview in the office of the Professor. I was offered the position immediately following the interview in the office. I found this to be an extremely appropriate experience and the relationship was mutual between parties.
Interview Questions: Can you describe the word creative in the most creative way possible?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lafayette College (Easton, PA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy.   The department head was inviting, friendly and interested.  I was given a tour and met with some faculty and staff who were also very friendly.  I was reimbursed for my travel.
Interview Questions: Prior role

title: Department Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lafayette College (Easton, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and application to HR, Department contacted me, met with Dept Head, Asst Dept Head, and a few Professors. Very congenial!
Interview Questions: They were interested most particularly in my transferable skills & temperament.

title: Facility Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lafayette College
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and within a week was contacted to do an interview as they grant interviews to everyone who applies.  The interview was a group interview of four individuals.
Interview Questions: We were asked question referring to our customer service qualities as this was a position for Lafayette College's recreation services.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lafayette College (Easton, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just met with professor one time. There wasn't much to talk about in the first place. I wanted to get some research experience my area of study and that is what the professor wanted to hear. I mentioned some classes I have taken before that would be useful with the research project. The interview was about 30 mins for just one day.
Interview Questions: Do you have Experience in a certain research software?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lafayette College (Easton, PA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had to show them how to fix computers. Questions were basic related to RAM, hard-drives etc. Basic use of antivirus is also a requirement. If you know how to do a hard drive , lcd, keyboard replacement, that's an added plus. Overall, the interview was short and to the point.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with computers? Can you fix a computer which is virus infected?

title: Hardwarer Shop Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lafayette College in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about the ability to fix the computers. Very easy going , taken by the students themselves. Its a good job, so a lot of people apply. Most of the workers are international students. You'll be lucky if you can get a job in here.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you fixed a computer.
